strings.Value: "Helping Ekun is our comradely duty. And if we need to throw a feast to do that — then that's what we're going to do!"
"What are you getting at?"
"Wonderful. What does this have to do with me?"
"No. My responsibilities do not include consoling or entertaining any of you."
"You are right. I can't stand looking at Ekun's glum face any longer — time to cheer him up!"
"Neither grief nor joy should be excessive. I think you've got a point."
"I don't have time for this."
"I don't care about Ekun's inner turmoil, but that's no reason to turn down a good party."
"Hello, Your Grace! ...Hmm, feels strange! It's amazing I can just go and have a chat with an actual baron{mf||ess}..."

"I wanted to talk about Ekun. I'm worried about him lately... Although 'worried' might be too strong a word. He is way too gloomy — even more so than usual, if that's possible. Life without a family must be hard for him..."
"I'm not sure I'd put it like that... but I'm glad you agreed!"

"Well, for one, he is your companion! Second, I can't abide him scowling another instant! Lastly? I want to know that when my ally is fighting beside me, they won't break — and Ekun feels too close to it already."
"But he is not completely alone! He has us! I know we can't replace what he lost, but we must remind him that we are here and he can talk to us!"

"What I'm getting at is that we should hold a merry revelry and use the opportunity to talk to him, heart to heart! If we just invite him for a drink, he'll no doubt refuse. So we must organize everything in secret! We'll gather guests, prepare food and drink, bring Ekun — and have so-o-o much fun! I'll even bring my lute! What do you say?"

"I've talked to Elina the innkeeper and she's happy to help us. Although… between us, I'm not sure what made her so enthusiastic... Anyway, you should talk to her. And I should go and think what I'm going to play!"
{n}Linzi's face brightens with a smile. {/n} "Wonderful! As we know, great minds think alike!"
{n}Linzi looks away, and her voice falters a bit.{/n} "Well, if... if that's how you feel about us..."
"And one more thing, don't be late! I fear if we don't pull Ekun out of his mood now, it'll be too late!"
{n}Linzi shakes her head, displeased.{/n}
"Pity. Well, I did what I could..."
